docs.snippet: An investigation has found insufficient evidence that Gov. Andrew Cuomo committed a federal crime through his handling of a commission he created to root out corruption in state government, U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara said Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: An investigation has found insufficient evidence that Gov. Andrew Cuomo committed a federal crime through his handling of a commission he created to root out corruption in state government, U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara said Monday.

headline.main: US Prosecutor Finds No Crime in NY Governor's Panel Shutdown
headline.print_headline: US Prosecutor Finds No Crime in NY Governor's Panel Shutdown

headline.main: US Court: Wearing Unearned Military Medals Is Free Speech

docs.snippet: The world where Jamar Clark lived and died from a police bullet illustrates that a city known for its robust economy has, by several measures, left its black population behind....
docs.lead_paragraph: The world where Jamar Clark lived and died from a police bullet illustrates that a city known for its robust economy has, by several measures, left its black population behind.
docs.abstract: Minneapolis, city long known for healthy economy, affordability and liberal politics, is grappling with deepening divide between blacks and whites; unemployment among blacks is about four times that of whites, with significant salary disparities; inequality is concentrated on city's north side, where about half of black population lives and where violence is rampant.

headline.main: Minneapolis’s Less Visible, and More Troubled, Side
headline.print_headline: Minneapolis Grapples With a Community Being Left Behind

byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen contributed reporting from New York. Susan Beachy contributed research.

docs.snippet: Argentine police commandos recaptured two of the country's most notorious convicts in a rice mill plant on Monday, ending a 15-day manhunt through backwater towns and flooded farm land in an episode underscoring the power of Argentina's narco gang...
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentine police commandos recaptured two of the country's most notorious convicts in a rice mill plant on Monday, ending a 15-day manhunt through backwater towns and flooded farm land in an episode underscoring the power of Argentina's narco gangs.

headline.main: Argentina Snares Remaining Fugitives, Says Rogue Forces Complicit
headline.print_headline: Argentina Snares Remaining Fugitives, Says Rogue Forces Complicit

docs.snippet: The Rev. Georg Ratzinger said in an interview that he had no knowledge that boys in the internationally known choir he once directed had been sexually abused....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Georg Ratzinger said in an interview that he had no knowledge that boys in the internationally known choir he once directed had been sexually abused.
docs.abstract: Rev Georg Ratzinger, German Roman Catholic Church official and older brother of pope emeritus Benedict XVI, says he had no knowledge of alleged sexual abuse committed against young boys of Bavarian choir he directed for 30 years, the Regensburger Domspatzen..

headline.main: Pope Benedict’s Brother Says He Was Unaware of Abuse
headline.print_headline: Benedict’s Brother Says He Was Unaware of Abuse

docs.snippet: Afghanistan is the world’s biggest opium producer, and there is evidence that the country’s drug problem is worse than government officials acknowledge....
docs.lead_paragraph: Afghanistan is the world’s biggest opium producer, and there is evidence that the country’s drug problem is worse than government officials acknowledge.
docs.abstract: Camp Phoenix Journal; Treatment and Rehabilitation Center opens at former military compound Camp Phoenix in Kabul, Afghanistan, world’s largest opium producing country; United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime reports 12.6 percent of Afghan adults are addicts, supplied by low-cost, readily available heroin and other opiates.

headline.main: From Under Kabul’s Bridges, Addicts Get Help at Old U.S. Base
headline.print_headline: From Under Kabul’s Bridges, Addicts Get Help at Old U.S. Base

docs.snippet: Britain's economy is heading into its seventh year of growth after the financial crisis but for many employers such as Mike Naylor, who runs a small metal-casting firm, business is too uncertain to raise staff pay by much this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's economy is heading into its seventh year of growth after the financial crisis but for many employers such as Mike Naylor, who runs a small metal-casting firm, business is too uncertain to raise staff pay by much this year.

headline.main: Insight-British Employers Keep Tight Grip on Pay Despite Recovery
